content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The image shows the Mesa Verde cliff dwellings in Colorado, part of the larger site of Mesa Verde, which was inhabited between 450 and 1300 C.E. Describe both the visual characteristics and the function of the Mesa Verde cliff dwellings. Using specific contextual evidence, explain how the design of the Mesa Verde cliff dwellings was influenced by an aspect of Ancestral Puebloan culture. Using specific contextual evidence, explain how the design of the Mesa Verde cliff dwellings was influenced by the site’s natural environment. Using specific evidence, explain why scholars have interpreted the abandonment of the cliff dwellings of Mesa Verde around 1300 C.E. as a reflection of changes that affected Ancestral Puebloan culture in the twelfth and thirteenth centuries C.E.
